solution_line_template: Mark has 60% 12 sided dice, so {mark_percentage_12_sided} * {mark_total_dice} = <<{mark_percentage_12_sided}*{mark_total_dice}={mark_12_sided_dice}>>{mark_12_sided_dice} 12 sided dice.
James has 75% 12 sided dice, so {james_percentage_12_sided} * {james_total_dice} = <<{james_percentage_12_sided}*{james_total_dice}={james_12_sided_dice}>>{james_12_sided_dice} 12 sided dice.

They will need to purchase {total_dice_needed} dice - {mark_12_sided_dice} dice - {james_12_sided_dice} dice = <<{total_dice_needed}-{mark_12_sided_dice}-{james_12_sided_dice}={dice_to_buy}>>{dice_to_buy} dice.
